title: Thai I
requirements: Not for students who have taken THAI2000(1002),2001,2050(1010) or 3000
description: This course invites students without prior knowledge of Thai to explore the basic features of the Thai language. Supported by audiovisual aids, students will receive intensive practice in spoken and written Thai through interactive class work, homework and online exercises. They will become familiar with the basic concepts of Thai grammar and learn how to interact in some simple everyday situations.
outcome: At the end of the course, the students will be able to conduct proper communication in various daily life situations, using basic knowledge of spoken Thai.

title: Thai II
requirements: 1.Prerequisite: THAI1000 (1001);2.Not for students who have taken THAI2001, 2050 (1010) or 3000
description: Building on the knowledge acquired in THAI1001, this course aims to further develop students' ability to communicate in Thai in various everyday situations. It also seeks to give students a taste of Thai culture and invites them to explore cultural differences. Through intensive practice students will develop more confidence in interacting in Thai while further expanding and solidifying their understanding of the basic grammar and pronunciation patterns.
outcome: At the end of the course, the students will be able to conduct proper communication in various daily life situations, using basic knowledge of spoken Thai.

title: Thai III
requirements: Prerequisite: THAI1002 or 1010 or equivalent competence
description: This course aims to further enhance students' communication skills in the four language domains listening, speaking, reading and writing. Students are expected to communicate confidently in a wider range of social interactions including more formal situations and simple professional contexts as well as reporting past events and sharing experience.

title: Thai I & II
requirements: Not for students who have taken THAI1000(1001), 2000(1002), 2001 or 3000
description: (Please read the study scheme note.) This is a summer intensive Thai course for beginners, covering the full syllabus of THAI1000 and 2000.

title: Thai IV
description: This course aims at increasing students' communicative fluency in oral and written Thai. Using a variety of classroom activities and multimedia, students will build up their competence in the four language domains listening, speaking, reading and writing. Through intensive practice they will be able to communicate in a wide range of social situations with the appropriate awareness of the pragmatic rules involved. Students receive guidance in the process of composing longer texts displaying a range of registers and styles relating to past, present and future events.
